main_definition: To take the place of something or someone else, often in a permanent way.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Insure that an item has been exchanged for another due to damage or malfunction
meanings_and_examples.example: The company replaced my broken laptop with a brand new one.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To substitute a person in their role, often temporarily
meanings_and_examples.example: After the manager resigned, his assistant took over and filled in for him until a replacement could be found.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Change one thing or element to another with the intention of improvement
meanings_and_examples.example: The restaurant replaced their old menu with a new one that included healthier options.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make use of something in place of what was originally intended
meanings_and_examples.example: Instead of using regular flour, I used almond flour to replace it in the recipe.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give up an old thing for a new one as part of change or personal growth
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to replace her negative habits with positive ones as she pursued self-improvement.
